cons: Chamomile extracts may trigger allergic reactions in those who are previously allergic to this.
Chamomile should not be used along with alcohol as it may lead to sedation and drowsiness beyond control.
Not recommended for pregnant or lactating women.
description: Chamomile flowers carry several active chemical substances such as chamazulene, bisabolol, apigenin, and luteolin, etc.
Consuming chamomile tea may help to stop as well as deal with colds whilst avoiding bacterial-related illness as well as infection.
Chamomile tea is shown to prevent the development of cancer cells within breast cancer, ovarian cancer, prostate cancer as well as other human cancer cell lines.

1 cup of brewed chamomile tea contains about 2 calories and .5 g carbohydrates. It also contains small amounts of calcium, magnesium, potassium, fluoride, folate and vitamin A, plus traces of several other nutrients.
name: Chamomile
